subject: New Cardiology IME Referral - Angela Chen - Case #CV-2025-9943
body:
Dear IME Scheduling Team,

We are referring a cardiovascular Independent Medical Examination for our client:

Full Name: Angela Chen
Date of Birth: 03/15/1972
Case Reference Number: CV-2025-9943
Examination Type: Cardiovascular/Cardiology IME
Requested Examination Date: April 15, 2025
Requested Time: 10:00 AM
Preferred Location: Los Angeles, CA

Referring Law Firm: Health Law Partners LLP
Attorney: Robert Martinez, Esq.
Direct Contact: referrals@healthlawpartners.com
Phone: (555) 123-4567
Report Deadline: April 29, 2025

Background: Client experienced cardiac event at workplace on February 1, 2025. Subsequent diagnosis of stress-induced cardiomyopathy. Please find attached cardiologist reports, EKG results, and echocardiogram findings.

Please confirm availability and provide any additional requirements.

Respectfully,
Robert Martinez, Esq.
Health Law Partners LLP

attachments.text_content: Cardiology Consultation Report - Angela Chen, DOB 03/15/1972. Patient presented to ER on February 1, 2025 with chest pain and shortness of breath. EKG showed ST-segment abnormalities. Troponin levels elevated. Echocardiogram revealed reduced ejection fraction (40%). Diagnosis: Takotsubo cardiomyopathy (stress-induced cardiomyopathy). Patient reports high-stress work environment preceding cardiac event. Currently on beta-blockers and ACE inhibitors. Follow-up echocardiogram in 8 weeks to assess cardiac function recovery.

Electrocardiogram Results: February 1, 2025 - Abnormal EKG showing T-wave inversions in precordial leads. Heart rate: 92 bpm. Rhythm: Sinus rhythm. ST-segment changes consistent with acute coronary syndrome. Follow-up EKG February 15, 2025 shows improvement with resolution of ST-segment changes. Current EKG March 1, 2025 demonstrates continued normalization of cardiac electrical activity.
